title: ByteTensor and Variable(ByteTensor) behavior different in subtraction
body_html:
In [1]: 1 - torch.ByteTensor([0,1,2,3])
Out[1]: 

   1
   0
 255
 254
[torch.ByteTensor of size 4]

In [2]: 1 - torch.autograd.Variable(torch.ByteTensor([0,1,2,3]))
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-2-ba87d7c6de27> in <module>()
----> 1 1 - torch.autograd.Variable(torch.ByteTensor([0,1,2,3]))

/home/tqichen/software/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/variable.py in __rsub__(self, other)
    824 
    825     def __rsub__(self, other):
--> 826         return SubConstant.apply(other, self)
    827 
    828     def __mul__(self, other):

/home/tqichen/software/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/_functions/basic_ops.py in forward(ctx, a, b, inplace)
    128                 return tensor.neg_().add_(constant)
    129             else:
--> 130                 return tensor.neg().add_(constant)
    131 
    132     @staticmethod

AttributeError: 'torch.ByteTensor' object has no attribute 'neg'

Not sure if this is in master, as this was done using the latest release version.

body:
```
In [1]: 1 - torch.ByteTensor([0,1,2,3])
Out[1]: 

   1
   0
 255
 254
[torch.ByteTensor of size 4]

In [2]: 1 - torch.autograd.Variable(torch.ByteTensor([0,1,2,3]))
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-2-ba87d7c6de27> in <module>()
----> 1 1 - torch.autograd.Variable(torch.ByteTensor([0,1,2,3]))

/home/tqichen/software/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/variable.py in __rsub__(self, other)
    824 
    825     def __rsub__(self, other):
--> 826         return SubConstant.apply(other, self)
    827 
    828     def __mul__(self, other):

/home/tqichen/software/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/_functions/basic_ops.py in forward(ctx, a, b, inplace)
    128                 return tensor.neg_().add_(constant)
    129             else:
--> 130                 return tensor.neg().add_(constant)
    131 
    132     @staticmethod

AttributeError: 'torch.ByteTensor' object has no attribute 'neg'
```

Not sure if this is in master, as this was done using the latest release version.
